title: Analysis of Practical Influencing Factors for Instructional Designers in Higher Education

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Process exploring instructional design challenges in higher education through activity theory-based case analysis

learning_goals: Learners can describe at least three core roles and responsibilities of instructional designers in higher education settings.
Learners can analyze organizational and technological factors influencing instructional design processes using the activity theory framework.
Learners can present case-specific examples of major conflict factors arising during collaboration between instructional designers and faculty.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
